medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3-4 days prior, progressively worsening. The pain is located in the right abdomen, is nonradiating, constant, and sharp. No associated fevers, chills, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, or anorexia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic back pain, seasonal allergies. Previous surgeries include microdiscectomy and tonsillectomy.
